intro: Seseli arcticum, commonly known as Arctic seseli, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, while its stems are often hairy. Seseli arcticum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and medicinal potential.
